html.p: What: Perform calculations on events while retaining all original events and fields
Why: eventstats creates summary stats of fields without changing total number of events in the results.
So What: Calculated fields while keeping original granularity of data

panel.html: We're using data we built earlier by using outputlookup. To build this see outputlookup | inputlookup mydata.csv While yours may differ slightly, that data for us is: "_time",salesperson,"Cars Sold This Hour" 1711665905,Rich,1 1711665905,David,1 1711662305,Rich,0 1711662305,David,0 1711658705,Rich,1 1711658705,David,2 1711655105,Rich,2 1711655105,David,3

p.pre: | inputlookup mydata.csv | eventstats avg("Cars Sold This Hour") as "Avg_cars_per_hour"

search.query: | inputlookup mydata.csv | eventstats avg("Cars Sold This Hour") as "Avg_cars_per_hour"

p.pre: | inputlookup mydata.csv | eventstats avg("Cars Sold This Hour") as "Avg_cars_per_hour" by salesperson

search.query: | inputlookup mydata.csv | eventstats avg("Cars Sold This Hour") as "Avg_cars_per_hour" by salesperson
